source.name: Air Quality Forecast Guidance
source.description: NOAA's National Weather Service National Air Quality Forecast System (AQFS) Graphic Forecast displays (http://www.weather.gov/aq) are web based presentations of gridded forecast guidance originating from the National Centers for Environmental Prediction (NCEP). Ozone and smoke data are displayed for a domain covering contiguous United States, Alaska and Hawaii.  Ozone is shown as 1-hour and 8-hour average concentrations(in parts per billion or ppb), and smoke concentration in 1-hour averages, updated twice daily.  Fire locations are provided by the NOAA's Satellite and Information Service Hazard Mapping System.  Additional information on air quailty can be found under EPA's AIRNow site.     For further information, please visit NOAA's Air Resources  Laboratory web site (http://www.arl.noaa.gov).
